verses.verse: My son<WH1121>, if thou be surety<WH6148> for thy friend<WH7453>, if thou hast stricken<WH8628> thy hand<WH3709> with a stranger<WH2114>,
Thou art snared<WH3369> with the words<WH561> of thy mouth<WH6310>, thou art taken<WH3920> with the words<WH561> of thy mouth<WH6310>.

Do<WH6213> this now<WH645>, my son<WH1121>, and deliver<WH5337> thyself, when thou art come<WH935> into the hand<WH3709> of thy friend<WH7453>; go<WH3212>, humble<WH7511> thyself, and make sure<WH7292> thy friend<WH7453>.
Give<WH5414> not sleep<WH8142> to thine eyes<WH5869>, nor slumber<WH8572> to thine eyelids<WH6079>.
Deliver<WH5337> thyself as a roe<WH6643> from the hand<WH3027> of the hunter, and as a bird<WH6833> from the hand<WH3027> of the fowler<WH3353>.
¶ Go<WH3212> to the ant<WH5244>, thou sluggard<WH6102>; consider<WH7200> her ways<WH1870>, and be wise<WH2449>:
Which having no guide<WH7101>, overseer<WH7860>, or ruler<WH4910>,
Provideth<WH3559> her meat<WH3899> in the summer<WH7019>, and gathereth<WH103> her food<WH3978> in the harvest<WH7105>.
How long wilt thou sleep<WH7901>, O sluggard<WH6102>? when wilt thou arise<WH6965> out of thy sleep<WH8142>?
Yet a little<WH4592> sleep<WH8142>, a little<WH4592> slumber<WH8572>, a little<WH4592> folding<WH2264> of the hands<WH3027> to sleep<WH7901>:
So shall thy poverty<WH7389> come<WH935> as one that travelleth<WH1980>, and thy want<WH4270> as an armed<WH4043> man<WH376>.
¶ A naughty<WH1100> person<WH120>, a wicked<WH205> man<WH376>, walketh<WH1980> with a froward<WH6143> mouth<WH6310>.
He winketh<WH7169> with his eyes<WH5869>, he speaketh<WH4448> with his feet<WH7272>, he teacheth<WH3384> with his fingers<WH676>;
Frowardness<WH8419> is in his heart<WH3820>, he deviseth<WH2790> mischief<WH7451> continually<WH6256>; he soweth<WH7971> discord<WH4066><WH4090>.
Therefore shall his calamity<WH343> come<WH935> suddenly<WH6597>; suddenly<WH6621> shall he be broken<WH7665> without remedy<WH4832>.
¶ These six<WH8337> things doth the LORD<WH3068> hate<WH8130>: yea, seven<WH7651> are an abomination<WH8441> unto him<WH5315>:
A proud<WH7311> look<WH5869>, a lying<WH8267> tongue<WH3956>, and hands<WH3027> that shed<WH8210> innocent<WH5355> blood<WH1818>,
An heart<WH3820> that deviseth<WH2790> wicked<WH205> imaginations<WH4284>, feet<WH7272> that be swift<WH4116> in running<WH7323> to mischief<WH7451>,
A false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> that speaketh<WH6315> lies<WH3577>, and he that soweth<WH7971> discord<WH4090> among brethren<WH251>.
¶ My son<WH1121>, keep<WH5341> thy father's<WH1> commandment<WH4687>, and forsake<WH5203> not the law<WH8451> of thy mother<WH517>:
Bind<WH7194> them continually<WH8548> upon thine heart<WH3820>, and tie<WH6029> them about thy neck<WH1621>.
When thou goest<WH1980>, it shall lead<WH5148> thee; when thou sleepest<WH7901>, it shall keep<WH8104> thee; and when thou awakest<WH6974>, it shall talk<WH7878> with thee.
For the commandment<WH4687> is a lamp<WH5216>; and the law<WH8451> is light<WH216>; and reproofs<WH8433> of instruction<WH4148> are the way<WH1870> of life<WH2416>:
To keep<WH8104> thee from the evil<WH7451> woman<WH802>, from the flattery<WH2513> of the tongue<WH3956> of a strange woman<WH5237>.
Lust<WH2530> not after her beauty<WH3308> in thine heart<WH3824>; neither let her take<WH3947> thee with her eyelids<WH6079>.
For by means of<WH1157> a whorish<WH2181> woman<WH802> a man is brought to a piece<WH3603> of bread<WH3899>: and the adulteress<WH802><WH376> will hunt<WH6679> for the precious<WH3368> life<WH5315>.
Can a man<WH376> take<WH2846> fire<WH784> in his bosom<WH2436>, and his clothes<WH899> not be burned<WH8313>?
Can one<WH376> go<WH1980> upon hot coals<WH1513>, and his feet<WH7272> not be burned<WH3554>?
So he that goeth in<WH935> to his neighbour's<WH7453> wife<WH802>; whosoever toucheth<WH5060> her shall not be innocent<WH5352>.
Men do not despise<WH936> a thief<WH1590>, if he steal<WH1589> to satisfy<WH4390> his soul<WH5315> when he is hungry<WH7456>;
But if he be found<WH4672>, he shall restore<WH7999> sevenfold<WH7659>; he shall give<WH5414> all the substance<WH1952> of his house<WH1004>.
But whoso committeth adultery<WH5003> with a woman<WH802> lacketh<WH2638> understanding<WH3820>: he that doeth<WH6213> it destroyeth<WH7843> his own soul<WH5315>.
A wound<WH5061> and dishonour<WH7036> shall he get<WH4672>; and his reproach<WH2781> shall not be wiped away<WH4229>.
For jealousy<WH7068> is the rage<WH2534> of a man<WH1397>: therefore he will not spare<WH2550> in the day<WH3117> of vengeance<WH5359>.
He will not regard<WH5375><WH6440> any ransom<WH3724>; neither will he rest content<WH14>, though thou givest many<WH7235> gifts<WH7810>.
